desc.p: Specifies the operator used to compare the value of the field in FIELD.NAME to the FIELD.VALUE(s).
Mandatory value if FIELD.NAME is entered must be either:
EQ - Equals
NE - Not equal
LK - Like
UL - Unlike
RG - In the range
NR - Not in the range
GE - Greater than or equal
GT - Greater than
LE - Less than or equal
LT - Less than

Specifies the value to be compared with the value extracted from the FIELD.NAME defined. Together with the OPERAND this is used to define if a condition is met.
Optional Input
Specifies if special processing is required to the FIELD.VALUE defined before comparison can take place.

A value of PERIOD will result in the FIELD.VALUE being added to the current T24 system date. For example a condition may be defined for bonds maturing in 6 months. This would be defined as FIELD.VALUE of 6M. If PERIOD is defined in this field a value of today plus 6 months would be compared to the bond maturity date.
The type of field which requires special processing to determine the condition.
Possible values:
PERIOD - Used to determine a period on from a date.

Contains the ID to the SC.PORT.CONDITION.TYPE to allow combinations of existing conditions to be defined.

This can be combined with conditions defined in FIELD.NAME to FIELD.VALUE or can simply be combined conditions. When conditions are specified here all combined conditions must be met in order for a comparison to be true.
Optional Input
Must exist in SC.PORT.CONDITION.TYPE

Contains the number of the condition. This is also the multi value location of the percentage of the portfolio meeting the specified conditon held in SC.PORT.MODEL in the fields CONDITION, COND.REF.VALUE and COND.REF.PERC.
Noinput field
Record id, minimum 3 characters, maximum 10, alpha numeric input.
The name of the field whose value is used in checking the Condition Type. This can be specified in the following formats:
Field name
Field name>File>Target Field

The field name must exist in the Standard Selection record for SC.POS.ASSET, the file specified must be defined in Standard Selection, Target Field must be a valid field in that Standard Selection record. I-descriptors may be defined if required.
Field Name must exist in the Standard Selection record for SC.POS.ASSET
File must a valid file with a Standard Selection record
Target Field must be a valid field in the Standard Selection record of the File Name
